question: Will 900,000 Russian personnel losses be reported before March 21, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered from various sources:

1. As of February 25, 2025, the estimated Russian personnel losses are approximately 869,530 according to the [Index Minfin](https://index.minfin.com.ua/en/russian-invading/casualties/). This is an increase of 1,300 from the previous day, indicating a consistent daily increase in casualties.

2. The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on February 19, 2025, that the total Russian personnel losses were approximately 862,390, with a daily increase of 1,300 soldiers.

3. The daily casualty rate has been consistently above 1,000 since July 25, 2024, and currently stands at about 1,300 per day.

Given the current rate of 1,300 casualties per day, and with the present total at approximately 869,530, it is likely that the 900,000 mark will be reached before March 21, 2025. The number of days remaining until March 21, 2025, is 24 days from February 25, 2025. At a rate of 1,300 casualties per day, this would add approximately 31,200 casualties, bringing the total to approximately 900,730 by March 20, 2025.

Therefore, given the current trends and data, the probability that the reported Russian personnel losses will reach 900,000 before March 21, 2025, is very high.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.95

search_results.title: https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-losses-of-the-russian-army-in-january-amounted-to-over-three-divisions-of-personnel-and-seven-tank-battalions
search_results.content:
---
title: The losses of the russian army in January amounted to over three divisions of personnel and seven tank battalions | MoD News
url: https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-losses-of-the-russian-army-in-january-amounted-to-over-three-divisions-of-personnel-and-seven-tank-battalions
hostname: mod.gov.ua
description: Combat operations at the front lines remained intense throughout the first month of 2025.
sitename: mod.gov.ua
date: 2025-02-03
---
# The losses of the russian army in January amounted to over three divisions of personnel and seven tank battalions

**Combat operations at the front lines remained intense throughout the first month of 2025. ****In January, 5,087 combat encounters were reported.**** Enemy tactical aviation dropped over 2,400 guided bombs on the positions of our defenders and cities adjacent to the front.**

According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the russian army suffered significant irrecoverable and sanitary casualties in January, totaling 48,240 soldiers. This is equivalent to the strength of more than three motorized rifle divisions of the russian army. Throughout the entire large-scale invasion, this number of russian troop losses was exceeded only in December 2024, with 48,670 casualties.

In January, our forces also incapacitated 230 enemy tanks. As the tank battalion comprises 31 vehicles, the enemy has faced losses roughly equivalent to nearly seven tank battalions due to destruction and damage.

Our warriors also destroyed 573 enemy armored fighting vehicles. This roughly equals the number of armored fighting vehicles in nearly three motorized rifle divisions.

Furthermore, Ukrainian warriors incapacitated 963 systems of russian artillery last month. One artillery division of the enemy comprises 18 artillery systems. As a result, our forces eliminated the equivalent of 50 artillery divisions in January.

### Tags

- Combat

---
title: During 2024, the russian army suffered its most severe losses, totaling over 430,000 soldiers, nearly 9,000 AFVs, and 3,700 tanks | MoD News
url: https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/during-2024-the-russian-army-suffered-its-most-severe-losses-totaling-over-430-000-soldiers-nearly-9-000-af-vs-and-3-700-tanks
hostname: mod.gov.ua
description: In 2024, the Defence Forces of Ukraine reduced the number of the russian army’s military personnel by 430,790
sitename: mod.gov.ua
date: 2025-01-02
---
# During 2024, the russian army suffered its most severe losses, totaling over 430,000 soldiers, nearly 9,000 AFVs, and 3,700 tanks

**In 2024, the Defence Forces of Ukraine reduced the number of the russian army’s military personnel by 430,790. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of nearly 36 motorized rifle divisions of the russian land forces. The total losses incurred by the enemy last year were more significant than those in 2022 and 2023.**

The month of December 2024 marked a record high for irrecoverable and sanitary casualties within the aggressor's troops, totaling 48,670 military personnel. This also marks the peak figure observed since the onset of the large-scale invasion. The previous large-scale figures of the russian army's military personnel losses were recorded in November 2024, when they amounted to 45,720.

The past year was also fruitful in terms of destroying enemy equipment. Warriors of the Ukrainian Defence Forces have destroyed and damaged 3,689 enemy tanks. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of 119 tank battalions. During May, the destruction of enemy tanks reached its highest point, with 428 vehicles being destroyed. According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, our military units destroyed 31 enemy tanks in a single day on May 12. This is equivalent to the number of vehicles in a tank battalion.

Last year, our warriors destroyed and damaged 8,956 armored fighting vehicles of the russian army. This roughly equals the number of AFVs in over 37 motorized rifle divisions. The highest number of enemy armored vehicles destroyed or disabled was recorded in October 2024, totaling 923 vehicles. The cost of this quantity of destroyed AFVs in a single month to the aggressor country's budget is estimated to be at least half a billion U.S. dollars. The daily record was set on November 12, with 81 AFVs destroyed.

Last year, Ukrainian warriors also incapacitated 13,050 units of enemy artillery systems. This would be enough…

[Truncated preview: showing 376 words out of ~468. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]

# Casualties of the Russian troops in Ukraine

In addition to the statistics available on our website, a new one has appeared on the losses of the enemy — the armed forces of the Russian Federation during the fighting against Ukraine (cumulatively).

- Source:
[Armed Forces of Ukraine](https://zsu.gov.ua/)

We also tried to estimate [the cost of military equipment that the Russian army has lost](https://index.minfin.com.ua/russian-invading/casualties/cost/) during the fighting against Ukraine since February 24, 2022.
Of course, these calculations are very approximate, and do not claim to be particularly accurate.
Nevertheless, they give an idea of the general order of losses — how many billions of dollars are left in the form of Russian scrap metal in the fields of Ukraine.

- 25.02.2025
- Tanks — 10182 (+5)
- Armored fighting vehicle — 21168 (+11)
- Artillery systems — 23652 (+26)
- MLRS — 1299
- Anti-aircraft warfare — 1083 (+2)
- Planes — 370

- Ships (boats) — 28
- Submarines — 1
- Cars and cisterns — 38582 (+138)
- Special equipment — 3759 (+2)
- Military personnel — aprx. 869530 people (+1300)

- Military personnel — aprx. 868230 people (+1050)

- 23.02.2025

- Artillery systems — 23582 (+54)
- MLRS — 1296 (+1)
- Anti-aircraft warfare — 1081 (+1)
- Planes — 370

- Cruise missiles — 3064
- Ships (boats) — 28
- Submarines — 1
- Cars and cisterns — 38334 (+91)
- Special equipment — 3757 (+3)
- Military personnel — aprx. 867180 people (+1180)

- 22.02.2025
- Tanks — 10161 (+15)
- Armored fighting vehicle — 21139 (+9)
- Artillery systems — 23528 (+66)
- MLRS — 1295
- Anti-aircraft warfare — 1080
- Planes — 370
- Helicopters — 331
- UAV — 26311 (+155)
- Cruise m…

search_results.content:
---
title: Russia loses 1,300 soldiers and 19 tanks over past day
author: Iryna Balachuk
url: https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/02/19/7499027/
hostname: pravda.com.ua
description: The General Staff has updated the data on Russia’s losses in the war. Russia has lost 1,300 soldiers killed and wounded and more than 400 weapons and pieces of military equipment over the past day alone.
sitename: Ukrainska Pravda
date: 2025-02-19
tags: ['General Staff, Russia, Casualties']
---
# Russia loses 1,300 soldiers and 19 tanks over past day

Wednesday, 19 February 2025, 07:22

The General Staff has updated the data on Russia's losses in the war. Russia has lost 1,300 soldiers killed and wounded and more than 400 weapons and pieces of military equipment over the past day alone.

**Source**: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on[ Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/pfbid02EfcbSMoDggxifrXMDV7S3YtwRMAc3eVLcF884txd61SXwdH68MKFmZ9a8U9Drir6l?locale=uk_UA)

**Details**: The total combat losses of the Russian forces between 24 February 2022 and 19 February 2025 are estimated to be as follows [figures in parentheses represent the latest losses – ed.]:

Advertisement:

- Approximately 862,390
**(+1,300)**military personnel; - 10,120
**(+19)**tanks; - 21,098
**(+23)**armoured combat vehicles; - 23,347
**(+72)**artillery systems; - 1,288
**(+3)**multiple-launch rocket systems; - 1,072
**(+4)**air defence systems; - 370 (+0) fixed-wing aircraft;
- 331 (+0) helicopters;
- 25,861
**(+175)**tactical and strategic UAVs; - 3,064 (0) cruise missiles;
- 28 (+0) ships/boats;
- 1 (+0) submarine;
- 37,825
**(+146)**vehicles and fuel tankers; - 3,752
**(+1)**special vehicles and other equipment.

The information is being confirmed.

**Support Ukrainska Pravda on ****Patreon****!**

# The losses of the russian army in January amounted to over three divisions of personnel and seven tank battalions

**Combat operations at the front lines remained intense throughout the first month of 2025. ****In January, 5,087 combat encounters were reported.**** Enemy tactical aviation dropped over 2,400 guided bombs on the positions of our defenders and cities adjacent to the front.**

According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the russian army suffered significant irrecoverable and sanitary casualties in January, totaling 48,240 soldiers. This is equivalent to the strength of more than three motorized rifle divisions of the russian army. Throughout the entire large-scale invasion, this number of russian troop losses was exceeded only in December 2024, with 48,670 casualties.

In January, our forces also incapacitated 230 enemy tanks. As the tank battalion comprises 31 vehicles, the enemy has faced losses roughly equivalent to nearly seven tank battalions due to destruction and damage.

Our warriors also destroyed 573 enemy armored fighting vehicles. This roughly equals the number of armored fighting vehicles in nearly three motorized rifle divisions.

Furthermore, Ukrainian warriors incapacitated 963 systems of russian artillery last month. One artillery division of the enemy comprises 18 artillery systems. As a result, our forces eliminated the equivalent of 50 artillery divisions in January.

### Tags

- Combat

description: In 2024, the Defence Forces of Ukraine reduced the number of the russian army’s military personnel by 430,790
sitename: mod.gov.ua
date: 2025-01-02
---
# During 2024, the russian army suffered its most severe losses, totaling over 430,000 soldiers, nearly 9,000 AFVs, and 3,700 tanks

**In 2024, the Defence Forces of Ukraine reduced the number of the russian army’s military personnel by 430,790. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of nearly 36 motorized rifle divisions of the russian land forces. The total losses incurred by the enemy last year were more significant than those in 2022 and 2023.**

The month of December 2024 marked a record high for irrecoverable and sanitary casualties within the aggressor's troops, totaling 48,670 military personnel. This also marks the peak figure observed since the onset of the large-scale invasion. The previous large-scale figures of the russian army's military personnel losses were recorded in November 2024, when they amounted to 45,720.

The past year was also fruitful in terms of destroying enemy equipment. Warriors of the Ukrainian Defence Forces have destroyed and damaged 3,689 enemy tanks. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of 119 tank battalions. During May, the destruction of enemy tanks reached its highest point, with 428 vehicles being destroyed. According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, our military units destroyed 31 enemy tanks in a single day on May 12. This is equivalent to the number of vehicles in a tank battalion.

Last year, our warriors destroyed and damaged 8,956 armored fighting vehicles of the russian army. This roughly equals the number of AFVs in over 37 motorized rifle divisions. The highest number of enemy armored vehicles destroyed or disabled was recorded in October 2024, totaling 923 vehicles. The cost of this quantity of destroyed AFVs in a single month to the aggressor country's budget is estimated to be at least half a billion U.S. dollars. The daily record was set on November 12, with 81 AFVs destroyed.

Last year, Ukrainian warriors also incapacitated 13,050 units of enemy artillery systems. This would be enough…

[Truncated preview: showing 376 words out of ~468. # Casualties of the Russian troops in Ukraine

In addition to the statistics available on our website, a new one has appeared on the losses of the enemy — the armed forces of the Russian Federation during the fighting against Ukraine (cumulatively).

- Source:
[Armed Forces of Ukraine](https://zsu.gov.ua/)

We also tried to estimate [the cost of military equipment that the Russian army has lost](https://index.minfin.com.ua/russian-invading/casualties/cost/) during the fighting against Ukraine since February 24, 2022.
Of course, these calculations are very approximate, and do not claim to be particularly accurate.
Nevertheless, they give an idea of the general order of losses — how many billions of dollars are left in the form of Russian scrap metal in the fields of Ukraine.

- 25.02.2025
- Tanks — 10182 (+5)
- Armored fighting vehicle — 21168 (+11)

---
title: Russia loses 1,300 soldiers and 19 tanks over past day
author: Iryna Balachuk
url: https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2025/02/19/7499027/
hostname: pravda.com.ua
description: The General Staff has updated the data on Russia’s losses in the war. Russia has lost 1,300 soldiers killed and wounded and more than 400 weapons and pieces of military equipment over the past day alone.
sitename: Ukrainska Pravda
date: 2025-02-19
tags: ['General Staff, Russia, Casualties']
---
# Russia loses 1,300 soldiers and 19 tanks over past day

Wednesday, 19 February 2025, 07:22

The General Staff has updated the data on Russia's losses in the war. Russia has lost 1,300 soldiers killed and wounded and more than 400 weapons and pieces of military equipment over the past day alone.

**Source**: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on[ Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/pfbid02EfcbSMoDggxifrXMDV7S3YtwRMAc3eVLcF884txd61SXwdH68MKFmZ9a8U9Drir6l?locale=uk_UA)

**Details**: The total combat losses of the Russian forces between 24 February 2022 and 19 February 2025 are estimated to be as follows [figures in parentheses represent the latest losses – ed.]:

Advertisement:

- Approximately 862,390
**(+1,300)**military personnel; - 10,120
**(+19)**tanks; - 21,098
**(+23)**armoured combat vehicles; - 23,347
**(+72)**artillery systems; - 1,288
**(+3)**multiple-launch rocket systems; - 1,072
**(+4)**air defence systems; - 370 (+0) fixed-wing aircraft;
- 331 (+0) helicopters;
- 25,861
**(+175)**tactical and strategic UAVs; - 3,064 (0) cruise missiles;
- 28 (+0) ships/boats;
- 1 (+0) submarine;
- 37,825
**(+146)**vehicles and fuel tankers; - 3,752
**(+1)**special vehicles and other equipment.

The information is being confirmed.

**Support Ukrainska Pravda on ****Patreon****!**

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will 900,000 Russian personnel losses be reported before March 21, 2025?
Background: Since the beginning of the Russian invasion in 2022, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine releases their daily estimation of Russian losses in personnel, vehicles, aircraft, and other military equipment on their pages in social networks (see links in Resolution Criteria).

On February 19, 2025, they [reported](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-estimated-combat-losses-of-russians-over-the-last-day-1-300-persons-175-ua-vs-and-72-artillery-systems) a total of 862,390 estimated casualties. At the same time the daily rate is being constantly above 1000 since July 25, 2024. With the pace of 1300 casualties per day the number of 900,000 casualties should be reached on March 20, 2025.

Historical data can be tracked by independent trackers
such as [russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/) , [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and in the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json).
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before March 21, 2025, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reports 900,000 or more total Russian personnel losses on their [official site](https://mod.gov.ua/en/news?tags=Combat) or public media pages ([Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua), [Telegram](https://t.me/GeneralStaffZSU), [X.com](https://x.com/GeneralStaffUA)).

If all reports published before March 21, 2025 show numbers below 900,000, this question resolves as **No**. This includes the case when the General Staff of the AFU stops publishing their data due to a ceasefire or peace agreement.
Fine print: * "Personnel losses" in this context are *killed and wounded* soldiers and that wounded soldiers may return to the battlefield later.
* In the past there was at least one occasion on [May 27, 2023](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/594141432898939?ref=embed_post) when the error in the previous day's report was admitted and corrected. For this reason, the question will resolve two days later than any published report, although it will retroactively close before the date the report was first published.
* Historical trackers mentioned in the Background information ([russian-casualties-in-ua](https://russian-casualties.in.ua/), [Combat.FYI](https://combat.fyi/) and the [2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset](https://github.com/PetroIvaniuk/2022-Ukraine-Russia-War-Dataset/blob/main/data/russia_losses_personnel.json)) may be used as secondary resolution sources if the main resolution pages are banned/unavailable.
present_date: 2025-02-25T14:20:42.674117


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

messages.content:
{"url": "https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-losses-of-the-russian-army-in-january-amounted-to-over-three-divisions-of-personnel-and-seven-tank-battalions", "snippet": "---
title: The losses of the russian army in January amounted to over three divisions of personnel and seven tank battalions | MoD News
url: https://mod.gov.ua/en/news/the-losses-of-the-russian-army-in-january-amounted-to-over-three-divisions-of-personnel-and-seven-tank-battalions
hostname: mod.gov.ua
description: Combat operations at the front lines remained intense throughout the first month of 2025.
sitename: mod.gov.ua
date: 2025-02-03
---
# The losses of the russian army in January amounted to over three divisions of personnel and seven tank battalions

**Combat operations at the front lines remained intense throughout the first month of 2025. ****In January, 5,087 combat encounters were reported.**** Enemy tactical aviation dropped over 2,400 guided bombs on the positions of our defenders and cities adjacent to the front.**

According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the russian army suffered significant irrecoverable and sanitary casualties in January, totaling 48,240 soldiers. This is equivalent to the strength of more than three motorized rifle divisions of the russian army. Throughout the entire large-scale invasion, this number of russian troop losses was exceeded only in December 2024, with 48,670 casualties.

In January, our forces also incapacitated 230 enemy tanks. As the tank battalion comprises 31 vehicles, the enemy has faced losses roughly equivalent to nearly seven tank battalions due to destruction and damage.

Our warriors also destroyed 573 enemy armored fighting vehicles. This roughly equals the number of armored fighting vehicles in nearly three motorized rifle divisions.

Furthermore, Ukrainian warriors incapacitated 963 systems of russian artillery last month. One artillery division of the enemy comprises 18 artillery systems. As a result, our forces eliminated the equivalent of 50 artillery divisions in January.

### Tags

# During 2024, the russian army suffered its most severe losses, totaling over 430,000 soldiers, nearly 9,000 AFVs, and 3,700 tanks

**In 2024, the Defence Forces of Ukraine reduced the number of the russian army’s military personnel by 430,790. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of nearly 36 motorized rifle divisions of the russian land forces. The total losses incurred by the enemy last year were more significant than those in 2022 and 2023.**

The month of December 2024 marked a record high for irrecoverable and sanitary casualties within the aggressor's troops, totaling 48,670 military personnel. This also marks the peak figure observed since the onset of the large-scale invasion. The previous large-scale figures of the russian army's military personnel losses were recorded in November 2024, when they amounted to 45,720.

The past year was also fruitful in terms of destroying enemy equipment. Warriors of the Ukrainian Defence Forces have destroyed and damaged 3,689 enemy tanks. This is roughly equivalent to the strength of 119 tank battalions. During May, the destruction of enemy tanks reached its highest point, with 428 vehicles being destroyed. According to the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, our military units destroyed 31 enemy tanks in a single day on May 12. This is equivalent to the number of vehicles in a tank battalion.

Last year, our warriors destroyed and damaged 8,956 armored fighting vehicles of the russian army. This roughly equals the number of AFVs in over 37 motorized rifle divisions. The highest number of enemy armored vehicles destroyed or disabled was recorded in October 2024, totaling 923 vehicles. The cost of this quantity of destroyed AFVs in a single month to the aggressor country's budget is estimated to be at least half a billion U.S. dollars. The daily record was set on November 12, with 81 AFVs destroyed.

Last year, Ukrainian warriors also incapacitated 13,050 units of enemy artillery systems. This would be enough…

# Casualties of the Russian troops in Ukraine

In addition to the statistics available on our website, a new one has appeared on the losses of the enemy — the armed forces of the Russian Federation during the fighting against Ukraine (cumulatively).

- Source:
[Armed Forces of Ukraine](https://zsu.gov.ua/)

We also tried to estimate [the cost of military equipment that the Russian army has lost](https://index.minfin.com.ua/russian-invading/casualties/cost/) during the fighting against Ukraine since February 24, 2022.
Of course, these calculations are very approximate, and do not claim to be particularly accurate.
Nevertheless, they give an idea of the general order of losses — how many billions of dollars are left in the form of Russian scrap metal in the fields of Ukraine.

- 25.02.2025
- Tanks — 10182 (+5)
- Armored fighting vehicle — 21168 (+11)

- Special equipment — 3759 (+2)
- Military personnel — aprx. 869530 people (+1300)

---
# Russia loses 1,300 soldiers and 19 tanks over past day

Wednesday, 19 February 2025, 07:22

The General Staff has updated the data on Russia's losses in the war. Russia has lost 1,300 soldiers killed and wounded and more than 400 weapons and pieces of military equipment over the past day alone.

**Source**: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on[ Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GeneralStaff.ua/posts/pfbid02EfcbSMoDggxifrXMDV7S3YtwRMAc3eVLcF884txd61SXwdH68MKFmZ9a8U9Drir6l?locale=uk_UA)

**Details**: The total combat losses of the Russian forces between 24 February 2022 and 19 February 2025 are estimated to be as follows [figures in parentheses represent the latest losses – ed.]:

Advertisement:

- Approximately 862,390
**(+1,300)**military personnel; - 10,120
**(+19)**tanks; - 21,098
**(+23)**armoured combat vehicles; - 23,347
**(+72)**artillery systems; - 1,288
**(+3)**multiple-launch rocket systems; - 1,072
**(+4)**air defence systems; - 370 (+0) fixed-wing aircraft;
- 331 (+0) helicopters;
- 25,861
**(+175)**tactical and strategic UAVs; - 3,064 (0) cruise missiles;
- 28 (+0) ships/boats;
- 1 (+0) submarine;
- 37,825
**(+146)**vehicles and fuel tankers; - 3,752
**(+1)**special vehicles and other equipment.

The information is being confirmed.

**Support Ukrainska Pravda on ****Patreon****!**", "word_count": 241, "snippet_word_count": 241, "snippet_truncated": false, "date_cutoff_start": "2025-01-28T14:20:42.674117", "date_cutoff_end": "2025-02-26T14:20:42.674117", "cached_at": "2025-10-24T03:26:43.485199"}
messages.name: btf_fetch_url_content

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered from various sources:

1. As of February 25, 2025, the estimated Russian personnel losses are approximately 869,530 according to the [Index Minfin](https://index.minfin.com.ua/en/russian-invading/casualties/). This is an increase of 1,300 from the previous day, indicating a consistent daily increase in casualties.

2. The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported on February 19, 2025, that the total Russian personnel losses were approximately 862,390, with a daily increase of 1,300 soldiers.

3. The daily casualty rate has been consistently above 1,000 since July 25, 2024, and currently stands at about 1,300 per day.

Given the current rate of 1,300 casualties per day, and with the present total at approximately 869,530, it is likely that the 900,000 mark will be reached before March 21, 2025. The number of days remaining until March 21, 2025, is 24 days from February 25, 2025. At a rate of 1,300 casualties per day, this would add approximately 31,200 casualties, bringing the total to approximately 900,730 by March 20, 2025.

Therefore, given the current trends and data, the probability that the reported Russian personnel losses will reach 900,000 before March 21, 2025, is very high.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.95
